channel.title: Comments for page "Video Game Tournament"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Video Game Tournament"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Yeah, that would make sense, I'd say, kind of like another experience stat. Obviously, the better you do, the more "experience" you'd get, and therefore, the faster you'd get Prime Target/MoD…I haven't been getting to round 2 that often…it's gonna be awhile for me o_O

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I think what someone else said about it- that you get a number of "points" in a hidden tally that increases based on going- is most likely the truth. It wouldn't be a flat number gain, but something, I think, closer to the Determination Bonus.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I got Prime Target last con and I haven't been doing every video game tournament. I won the first one on the first week and I think I've been in 5 more afterwards. Haven't won, but I've at least made it to round 2 on each one. So it could be loosing 5 tournies is the same as winning one, where prime target is concerned. Or it could just be a rolling chance that goes up with each tourny.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I don't think so. Since having PT doesn't indicate much about your skill, I doubt it affects the bracket. Besides, what would it be? There is a normal bracket and a winner bracket. Prime Target-ers can be from both. I doubt that McM would make it so that if you have PT you are with everybody else who have PT, so you are with those who won twice already, likely to not show up at all and are doing cosplay = life much easier. And I doubt it would be that there is a normal bracket, PT bracket, winner bracket and winner & PT bracket, since those with PT and the trophy are likely to not even show up, and the PT bracket would be so empty it will make those with the target have much easier time winning the trophy.

And there is no logic behind sending those with PT to the winners bracket.

item.title: Prime target
item.content:encoded:
Just a thought- does prime target affect what bracket you get put into?

I was just thinking, if some poor unlucky guy gets prime target before actually winning the trophy, it would make his life a lot harder xD

item.title: Cheese effects
item.content:encoded:
http://www.animecubed.com/billy/forum/viewtopic.php?f=1&t=16002&start=18

Cheese has a cap. Cap not currently known.

Having X more cheese than opponent gives you -X strength.

On front page:
Friday 10/22 (11:27):

Flowed Wanders in Cons can no longer give Cheese or Internet Famous. Note, for the umpteenth time, that too much Cheese actually hurts your character, but now the 'problem' is solved regardless.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I think it may be a bit random, since at least one person gained it that way and he got it before this con.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I just got this notice today, checking my VGT results after dayroll -

You made it to Round 2!

A number of competitors give you the woggly eye for being at so many tourneys - you had better watch out!
You got Prime Target!

+20 Videogaming XP!

I have done every VGT since BillyCon opened, so I want to say that this is my 10th Con? Somewhere around there, I wasn't really keeping track. For the record, I've never won first place either, the best I've managed is Round 4.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: No. You get 2 skillz for level 1. An additional 1 skillz for level 2, and two more for level 3. Level 4 gives nothing, level 5 is unknown.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: So, basically, 2 skillz for lvl 1, and an additional skillz for each level after that? Just confirming it, as I'm a little unclear on the whole thing o_O I'm still at the "level your main skills up so you don't completely stink" stage.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: If you have VG1 you get 2 skillz. If you have VG2 you get 3 skillz (2 for VG1 and 1 for VG2). If you have VG3 you get an extra of two skillz.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Gah, I already left the con and I can't remember… But I'm positive that videogame skill >2 gives a bonus, and I'm pretty sure this last time I had a total of 12 skillz, so there's at least a couple more to be added yet. I remember testing having max sleep and didn't get anything more for that…

Anyway, I'll play again next week, and try to notice what bonuses I get. Maybe there's a bonus for 20+ cool? I think I had it this time…

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Wait…so "Videogame skill" gives 2 skillz, and videogame skill >1 gives 1 skillz? Does that mean that if you have any levels, you get 2 skillz, and if it's higher than 1, you get another point, or what?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I won a second Tournament after winning the trophy. Instead of the normal message, I got this:

"A number of competitors give you the woggly eye - you had better watch out!
You got Prime Target!"

Prime Target is a permanent effect.

item.title: Rewards for ...
item.content:encoded: Round 3 does not give any monies. Round 4 gives 10 monies.
